tags.name: functions
tags.description: SP API to list Virtual Network Functions (VNFs) available in the Catalogue

tags.name: packages
tags.description: SP API to manage packages (uploading, downloading, etc.)

tags.name: pings
tags.description: SP API to implement readiness and liveness

tags.name: policies
tags.description: SP API to manage placement and run-time policies

tags.name: records
tags.description: SP API to list function or service records available in the Repository

tags.name: requests
tags.description: SP API to manage services' and slices' lifecycle events (creation, scaling, deletion, etc.)

tags.name: services
tags.description: SP API to list Network Services (NSs) available in the Catalogue

tags.name: settings
tags.description: SP API to manage different kinds of settings

tags.name: SLAs
tags.description: SP API to manage SLA aggreements, configurations, licenses, templates and violations

tags.name: slices
tags.description: SP API to manage slice templates and slice instances (creation and deletion are handled through requests)

descriptor_schema.description: The descriptor schema the template follows

name.description: The name of the sla template

vendor.description: The vendor of the sla template

version.description: The version of the sla template

author.description: The author/s of the sla template

description.description: A simple description of the sla template

template_name.description: The user defined sla template name

provider_name.description: The network provider that requested the creation of the template. e.g. Telefonica.

template_initiator.description: The user who created the sla template

guaranteeID.description: The id of the selected guarantee term

guarantee_name.description: The name of the selected guarantee term

guarantee_definition.description: A short definition of the selected guarantee term

guarantee_threshold.description: The value of the selected guarantee term

guarantee_operator.description: The operator describing the expression of the selected guarantee term

guarantee_unit.description: The unit describing the selected guarantee term

guarantee_period.description: The period that the guarantee term will be calculated

target_kpi.description: The target slo that is going to be monitored

target_value.description: The monitoring target_value of the guarantee

target_operator.description: The operator describing the realtion between the target slo and thne guaranteed threshold

target_duration.description: The monitoring duration of the targeted slo

target_period.description: The period that the target slo will be calculated

target_service_level.description: The full expression of the guaranteed slo

service_licence_type.description: The type of the license for the NS - Public|Trial|Private

service_licence_instances.description: The allowed NS instances the the license can provide

service_licence_expiration_date.description: The expiration date of the license

schema.description: The definition of the general "ProblemDetails" data structure from IETF RFC 7807 [19] is reproduced inthis structure. Compared to the general framework defined in IETF RFC 7807 [19], the "status" and "detail" attributes are mandated to be included by the present document, to ensure that the response contains additional textual information about an error. IETF RFC 7807 [19] foresees extensibility of the "ProblemDetails" type. It is possible that particular APIs in the present document, or particular implementations, define extensions to define additional attributes that provide more information about the error. The description column only provides some explanation of the meaning to Facilitate understanding of the design. For a full description, see IETF RFC 7807 [19].

type.description: A URI reference according to IETF RFC 3986 [5] that identifies the problem type. It is encouraged that the URI provides human-readable documentation for the problem (e.g. using HTML) when dereferenced. When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It should not change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization. If type is given and other than "about:blank", this attribute shall also be provided. A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.  It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).

status.description: The HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem. The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may yield further information if dereferenced.

500.description: If there is an application error not related to the client's input that cannot be easily mapped to any other HTTP response code ("catch all error").

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A longer explanation of the specific occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

404.description: If the API producer did not find a current representation for the resource addressed by the URI passed in the request, or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

406.description: If the "Accept" HTTP header does not contain at least one name of a content type that is acceptable to the API producer.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

schema.description: General "ProblemDetails" data structure from IETF RFC 7807 [19].

type.description: Problem type according to IETF RFC 3986 [5]

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

status.description: The HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A longer explanation of the specific occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

422.description: If the payload body of a request contains syntactically correct data (e.g. well-formed JSON) but the data cannot be processed (e.g. because it fails validation against a schema).

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response.

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

schema.description: The definition of the general "ProblemDetails" data structure from IETF RFC 7807 [19] is reproduced inthis structure. Compared to the general framework defined in IETF RFC 7807 [19], the "status" and "detail" attributes are mandated to be included by the present document, to ensure that the response contains additional textual information about an error. IETF RFC 7807 [19] foresees extensibility of the "ProblemDetails" type. It is possible that particular APIs in the present document, or particular implementations, define extensions to define additional attributes that provide more information about the error. The description column only provides some explanation of the meaning to Facilitate understanding of the design. For a full description, see IETF RFC 7807 [19].

type.description: A URI reference according to IETF RFC 3986 [5] that identifies the problem type. It is encouraged that the URI provides human-readable documentation for the problem (e.g. using HTML) when dereferenced. When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It should not change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization. If type is given and other than "about:blank", this attribute shall also be provided. A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.  It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).

status.description: The HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem. The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may yield further information if dereferenced.

500.description: If there is an application error not related to the client's input that cannot be easily mapped to any other HTTP response code ("catch all error").

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

schema.description: General "ProblemDetails" data structure from IETF RFC 7807 [19].

type.description: Problem type according to IETF RFC 3986 [5]

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

status.description: The HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A longer explanation of the specific occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

503.description: If the API producer encounters an internal overload situation of itself or of a system it relies on.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

schema.description: General "ProblemDetails" data structure from IETF RFC 7807 [19].

status.description: The HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A longer explanation of the specific occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

get.description: **Query NST**: Get a particular NST information.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

schema.description: The generated NST object.

400.description: If the request is malformed or syntactically incorrect.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

WWW-Authenticate.description: Challenge if the corresponding HTTP request has not provided authorization, or error details if the corresponding HTTP request has provided an invalid authorization token.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the body of the response ("application/problem+json").

status.description: Status of the unpacking process: waiting|runnig|failed|done

uuid.description: The UUID of the entity to which the instantiation request is related to (Service or Slice) -- mandatory for request_type CREATE_SERVICE (default) and CREATE_SLICE (nstId)

instance_uuid.description: The UUID of the instance of the entity to which the request is related to (Service or Slice) -- mandatory for request_type TERMINATE_SERVICE and TERMINATE_SLICE

egresses.description: List of egress points to be taken into consideration during the instantiation

ingresses.description: List of ingress points to be taken into consideration during the instantiation

blacklist.description: List of sites where not to instantiate

callback.description: The callback to call when the instantiation is ready

name.description: The callback to call when the instantiation is ready

description.description: The callback to call when the instantiation is ready

sla_id.description: The callback to call when the instantiation is ready

policy_id.description: The callback to call when the instantiation is ready

blacklist.description: List of sites where not to instantiate

callback.description: The callback to call when the request status changes

created_at.description: The time at which the request has been created

customer_name.description: The name of the Customer making the request

customer_email.description: The email of the Customer making the request

egresses.description: List of egress points to be taken into consideration during the instantiation

error.description: Text describing the error ocurred in the request, if thre is any

ingresses.description: List of ingress points to be taken into consideration during the instantiation

instance_uuid.description: The UUID of the instance of the entity to which the request is related to (Service or Slice) -- mandatory for TERMINATION

nstId.description: The UUID of the slice template to which the request is related to -- mandatory for CREATION

request_type.description: The type of the request. Defaults to CREATE_SERVICE, but can also be TERMINATE_SERVICE, CREATE_SLICE, TERMINATE_SLICE, SCALE_SERVICE or MIGRATE_FUNCTION

service_uuid.description: The UUID of the service to which the request is related to -- mandatory for CREATION

sla_id.description: The UUID of the SLA chosen by the customer

policy_id.description: The UUID of the policy related to the above SLA UUID

status.description: The status of the request: starts NEW, becomes INSTANTIATING or TERMINATING while the MANO does the work, and finishes either READY (success) or ERROR (fail)

updated_at.description: The time at which the request has been updated

uuid.description: The UUID of the VIM -- required for type 'endpoint' and 'emu'

name.description: The name of the VIM -- required

country.description: The country of the VIM -- optional

city.description: The city of the VIM -- optional

endpoint.description: The endpoint of the VIM -- required

username.description: The username of the VIM -- required for type 'heat'

password.description: The password of the VIM -- required for type 'heat'

domain.description: The domain of the VIM  -- optional

config.description: The config of the VIM stored in DB -- required for type 'k8s', forbiden for type 'heat', optional for other types

tenant.description: The tenant of the HEAT VIM  -- required for type 'heat', forbiden for other types

network_endpoint.description: The network endpoint of the HEAT VIM  -- required for type 'heat', forbiden for other types -- if empy use mock network wrapper, else use ovs network wrapper

private_network_prefix.description: The network prefix to create networks in HEAT VIM  -- required for type 'heat', forbiden for other types

private_network_length.description: The network length to create networks in HEAT VIM  -- required for type 'heat', forbiden for other types

external_network_id.description: The external network id in HEAT VIM  -- required for type 'heat', forbiden for other types

external_router_id.description: The external router id in HEAT VIM  -- required for type 'heat', forbiden for other types

external_router_ip.description: The external router IP in HEAT VIM  -- optional for type 'heat' (required if work with TAPI Wrapper), forbiden for other types

management_flow_ip.description: The IP for manage the flows in HEAT VIM  -- optional for type 'heat'  (required if work with TAPI Wrapper), forbiden for other types

floating_ip_ranging.description: The floating IP range in HEAT VIM  -- optional for type 'heat' (required if work with TAPI Wrapper), forbiden for other types

uuid.description: The UUID of the WIM -- optional

name.description: The name of the WIM -- required

endpoint.description: The endpoint of the WIM -- required

username.description: The username of the WIM -- optional

password.description: The password of the WIM -- optional

vim_list.description: The list with VIMs UUIDs connected by this WIM -- required

items.description: VIMs UUIDs connected by this WIM (This VIMs UUIDs must exist in the DB) -- required
